title: Penelope's Experiences in Scotland; Being Extracts from the Commonplace Book of Penelope Hamilton
author: Wiggin, Kate Douglas Smith
snippet: I lo'e the gentry o' the North,     The Southern men I lo'e,   The canty people o' the West,     The Paisley bodies too. The pawky folk o' Fife are dear,--     Sae dear are ane an' a',   That e'en to think that we maun pairt     Maist braks my hairt in twa.

title: Two gray tourists: from papers of Mr. Philemon Perch
author: Johnston, Richard Malcolm
snippet: It was the only paper he took. He'd always begin at the beginning,  * The Southern Recorder is published at Millidge- ville, Georgia, etc.,' and then on to the rates of advertising. He read slow and loud, and when he got tired he'd make a cross mark where he left off and begin there the next time he took up the paper.

title: T. De Witt Talmage; As I Knew Him
author: Talmage, Eleanor McCutcheon
snippet: While some of the best patriots ofthe North went down with the right motives to mingle in thereconstruction of the State governments of the South, many of thesepilgrimists were the cast-off and thieving politicians of the North,who, after being stoned out of Northern waters, crawled up on the beachat the South to sun themselves. The Southern States had enough dishonestmen of their own without any importation. The day of trouble passed.
